New York University Archives
Records of the Kanbar Institute for Film and Television, Tisch School of the Arts
Maurice Kanbar Institute of Film and Television
Maurice Kanbar Institute of Film and Television
RG.35.6
.5 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript letter box
1971-1991 The Records of the Kanbar Institute for Film and Television, Tisch School of the Arts, reveal the early history of the University Broadcast Lab, which served as a testbed for student-developed and -produced programs (a history contextualized by the Records of the Office of the Dean of the Tisch School of the Arts and the Records of the Office of Radio and Television). They also reflect the equipment available to and used by Kanbar Institute faculty, staff, and students in the 1980s. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Administrative records and unpublished reports of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation. Access to files spanning multiple years will be opened to researchers based on the date of the most recent materials. Board of Trustees records are closed for 35 years from the date of creation. Materials related to personnel, grievances, job and fellowship searches and applications, and all files that fall under the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) are permanently restricted. Additional restrictions may apply to other materials in this collection. For questions regarding specific restrictions, please contact the University Archives.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Transferred by Wendy Kaplan Goldberg, Program Administrator for the Kanbar Institute, October 31, 2022. The accession number associated with this transfer is 2022.086.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical note
The University Broadcast Lab, part of the Kanbar Institute for Film and Television, served as a testbed for student-developed and -produced programs (a history contextualized by the Records of the Office of the Dean of the Tisch School of the Arts and the Records of the Office of Radio and Television).
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Records of the Kanbar Institute for Film and Television, Tisch School of the Arts; RG 35.6; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were removed from their original albums and binder; they were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. At the time of accessioning a brief collection-level description was created to desribe the contents of this collection.
Scope and Contents
The Records of the Kanbar Institute for Film and Television, Tisch School of the Arts (1971-1991), reveal the early history of the University Broadcast Lab. They also reflect the equipment available to and used by Kanbar Institute faculty, staff, and students in the 1980s. This collection consists of printed matter (clippings, event listings, and press releases), contact sheets, memos, and meeting minutes.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact New York University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
